attributes.action: Make it a requirement. SENCO are only appointed if they have knowledge of ASD
attributes.background:
Special educational needs coordinators (SENCO's ) currently do not need to have any training or knowledge of any special education needs (SEN) to fulfil their job role in schools. 
How can SENCO support families and school and advise/coordinate care on a topic they have no  knowledge/experience of?

attributes.action: Introduce controls to curb the sky rocketing cost of renting within London.
attributes.background: The cost of renting is rising exponentially each year, leading to people living in sub-standard accommodation. Not everyone in London wishes to buy and while the government focuses on increasing the supply of affordable housing, it is hard to see how this will help curb extortionate rental prices.
attributes.additional_details:
It is difficult to find a 2 bed flat in zones 1-3 for less than £1450pm. This leads to young adults, families & students who aren't looking to buy or are trying to save a deposit living in overcrowded, shared accommodation. 
For most, there is little option but to turn to rental websites like 'Spareroom' and move into the ex-living room of a 3 bed shared house for £600 pm. If you are lucky, there will be 1 bathroom per 4 people. Sadly, most spend more than half their income on ever rising rent.

attributes.action: Affiliate all Primary and Secondary schools with an elderly care facility.
attributes.background:
The most beneficial thing we can do as a society is to find positive & mutually beneficial ways to integrate different groups. 
We should link schools with care homes etc, & have the children/young adults spend occasional classes helping at the facility, to develop relationships across generations.
attributes.additional_details:
There are roughly 2 schools for every care home in the UK, and the government predicts that we need to double the number of elderly care facilities over the next 20 years.
There already exists major concern, and huge gaps in the system. Workers in this field could certainly benefit from the involvement and support of the larger community.
It is well researched how beneficial generational integration is to elderly folk and youngsters alike. I feel it a wasted opportunity to not connect the two.

attributes.action: Allow UKSA to prosecute politicians who state incorrect statistics
attributes.background: In the recent campaign the Leave side kept mentioning the incorrect £350m amount going to the EU. The head of the ONS asked them to stop but they didn't. The UKSA should be able to prosecute politicians, political parties and campaigns from repeating incorrect stats and force to print retractions.
attributes.additional_details:
These 2 articles relate to the £350m claim.
https://fullfact.org/blog/2016/apr/uk-statistics-authority-350-million-eu-membership-fee-potentially-misleading/
www.theguardian.com/politics/reality-check/2016/may/23/does-the-eu-really-cost-the-uk-350m-a-week

As this article describes the UKSA are the organisation required to point out to politicians where they misuse statistics but they lack the teeth to do more.
www.bbc.co.uk/news/blogs-magazine-monitor-28061826

attributes.action: Discuss ways to ensure all private landlords protect deposits paid by tenants
attributes.background: Though the Housing Act 2004, Section 213 lays out what is expected of  private landlords and the requirements relating to tenancy deposits; a significant amount of private landlords fail to protect deposits put down by their tenants and escape the penalty for failing to do so.
attributes.additional_details: I am asking that the government discuss creating measures to ensure that all tenancy deposits are protected in a government backed scheme by private landlords. I submit that landlords should face a penalty for failing to protect tenancy deposits immediately after 30 days and not solely if a tenant takes their landlord to court usually half way through or at the end of a tenancy agreement.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal act for child contact denial to be accountable for.
attributes.background: Resident parents who deny contact between their children and the non-resident parent without due cause should be held accountable. It is a form of psychological child abuse. Justice for the affected children whose resident parents think they can play with their lives.
attributes.additional_details:
Reasons why contact is stopped:
1. The resident parent (RP) wants to start a new life and wants the non resident parent (NRP) out of the way.  
2. The RP wants money/property from the NRP and uses the children as bargaining pawns. 
3. The RP may see children as a way of getting a house, welfare money, and other benefits. 
4. The RP is possessive and wants all the children’s love. 
5. The RP dislikes the NRP new partner, who they see as a rival 'parent', so prevents the child seeing the NRP.

attributes.action: Move Trident from Scotland to Plymouth Devon
attributes.background: Scotland do not want Trident and the SNP have been fighting this vehemently . Meanwhile in Plymouth we have the capacity and would welcome the jobs with open arms

attributes.action: Raise the voting age to 21
attributes.background: Stop under 21s from voting due to lack of life experiences,

attributes.action: Institute an independent audit system for the EU Referendum count.
attributes.background: Recent elections have demonstrated an alarming series of errors which may be, or have been, deliberately used to distort the result beyond acceptable limits. There is no confidence in the Electoral Commission UK in their own handling of the necessary oversights at each stage of the process.
attributes.additional_details:
A series of known tactics are possibly being used to distort the result beyond acceptable margins, e.g. Barnet registers omitting names, May 2016; East Devon registers contains names which should not have been there, May 2015; South Thanet General Election count delay for twelve hours being unexplained, May 2015; the Legality of a variety of Electoral procedures being ignored by parties 2014-2015.Etc. 
A team of three independent inspectors must be appointed by an MP's Committee for each counting centre.

attributes.action: Petition, Allow MARINE LE PEN into the U.K. to give her Views On British Brexit.
attributes.background: Cameron allowed Obama into the U.K. To meet the Queen & to give his views on British Remaining in The E.U.
attributes.additional_details: Why allow Barack Hussein Obama, but not allow Donald Trump & Marine Le Pen, when Marine Le Pen has a European Passport?

attributes.action: Deactivation of implantable defibrillators (pacemakers) for Dementia Sufferers
attributes.background:
A widower says his dying wife’s life was prolonged unnecessarily because a pacemaker kept her alive after all hope of recovery was lost.
Abergele Pensioner - Ron Hastings’ wife Patricia suffered from vascular dementia and organ failure, and died in a local nursing home.
attributes.additional_details:
Medical experts say while the devices have helped keep thousands of people alive, there are times when prolonging life is not appropriate.
Mr Hastings, from Abergele , said he has now written to to his local representative, calling on them to make sure measures are in place. 
He said: “Pat was trying to breathe. The pacemaker would kick in and give her another few minutes and it would happen again.

http://www.dailypost.co.uk/news/north-wales-news/abergele-womans-life-unnecessarily-prolonged-11130453

attributes.action: Give consent to listed building owners who want to replace unoriginal features
attributes.background: Listed building consent uses the phrase "alter the character". This isn't defined further. We assert that the "character" should refer to the state of the property when it was first built and not refer to later alterations. An owner should be able to change such alterations without fear of sanction.
attributes.additional_details: In my case we have a conservation officer who wants to preserve incongruous 1970's paraphernalia (carpeted avocado bathrooms, blue concrete floors and artex ceilings) in an 1870's building. Vaguely written or subjectively interpretable laws, whose consequences actually act in opposition to their purpose (encouraging rather than dissuading investment in conservation) should be challenged.

attributes.action: Reform education, make it evidence based ato protect our children from stress.
attributes.background:
Children in the UK are some of the youngest to enter formal education & some of the most tested in Europe with no associated benefits. Other countries in Europe have better long term academic outcomes starting formal education at 7.
A radical overhaul of education is needed to protect our children.
attributes.additional_details: With large numbers of staff leaving the profession & many children suffering stress & depression, let's take a more evidence based approach to education.  In a culture which pushes mothers to return to work, home schooling isn't an option many can afford.  Let's give children a better start in life. Let them play & be kids not test them & force them to act as walking calculators & dictionaries. Let schooling from ages 4-7 be ALL about learning through play, not the 3 r's. They are our future.

attributes.action: End the illegal suffering of rabbits for their angora fur
attributes.background: Rabbits are loving and gentle creatures yet china and india want their fur to export to countries just to satisfy human vanity. However they literally grab the rabbit and rip out its fur until it screams in terror  and agony, this disgusting and inhumane practice MUST STOP NOW!
attributes.additional_details: The rabbits suffer this every 3 months some going into shock. After several years of pain they are hung upside down and have their throats slit. The people who do this are sick and cruel. So please sign the petition to urge the government to diplomatically put pressure on the Indian and chinese governments to end this horror. If you don't believe me about this then visit petas website  and watch the overwhelming  evidence filmed by them on the cruelty these rabbits suffer.

attributes.action: GIVE VOTING RIGHTS TO EU NATIONALS LIVING IN UK FOR MORE THAN 15 YRS
attributes.background:
In the Brexit referendum, Brits living abroad less than 15 years and all
Commenwealth citizens living in the UK were allowed to vote. It does not make sense for the government not to allow EU citizens to have a vote.
attributes.additional_details:
EU citizens living in the UK contribute financially, they are here legally and are often not allowed to vote in their home countries.
Equal rights should include the right to vote.
If the government has decided that Brits living abroad for more then 15 years should not be able to vote, then it should be obvious to grant EU citizens living here for 15 years and more the right to vote.
Many of the European nationals have not changed their passport because there was no need to.

attributes.action: Abolish the 2 year retake of the CBT.
attributes.background: Every two years I, as many other "L" riders, have to fork out another £90 to retake my compulsory bike test. I have no need to apply for my full  larger engine test due to my short commute (a full 15 miles a day). I do not know of any other vehicle licences that need to have a two year "refresher".

attributes.action: Increase sniffer dogs in airports and transport networks to reduce terror risk
attributes.background: After terror attacks in Paris and Brussels we must increase the presence of sniffer dogs in airports before security and on transport networks. Dogs are less intrusive that electronic security and have a six sense when it comes to detecting the fear and adrenalin of would be attackers.

attributes.action: Control the sale and use of catapults.
attributes.background:
My sons' cat was shot by a youth with a catapult. He has lost the sight in that eye. 
This youths involved are also targetting children.
I am requesting The Prime Minister classify catapults as offensive weapons with appropriate punishment for offenders.
attributes.additional_details:
At the moment it is difficult for the Police to do anything unless the youths are caught in the act. 
Catapults should only be sold to responsible adults, not people under the age of 18.

attributes.action: Stop the 2015-16 Immigrations Bill
attributes.background: If the Bill becomes a Law it will affect many people including legal and illigal immigrants to the UK. They will suffer backlashes such as negative effects on businesses, employment, property renting or buying, banking, finances, loans, unpaid wages, education etc.
attributes.additional_details: Applicants should be able to exercise their rights of appeal here in the UK, not in their home countries where they will not have access to full legal support nor their savings which have been confiscated by the UK Government. Decision mistakes made by Immigration Officers whilst interpreting the applicabe clauses and codes of guidance should give an automatic ground for an appeal. Immigrants who are financially able to rent privately should be enabled to do so whilst they await for decisions to be made on their applications and pending the outcome of an appeal. There are a lot of concerns highlighted in regard to the 2025-16 Bill. However, time and space do not permit mentioning at this time.

attributes.action: Improve accessibility to state benefits for the poor and sick.
attributes.background: ESA living allowances must rise. Many get nothing beyond a partner's low income, creating hardship. Allowances for age should end. Under 25s get less than over 25s though their needs are the same. Eligibility criteria for Income Support should widen beyond lone parents, the pregnant and carers.
attributes.additional_details:
With greater accessibility to benefits, the sick could focus more on their health. The foundation of state support would ease the suffering of people with mental illnesses, enabling greater engagement in treatment, and hastening their return to the workforce.

Relying on a partner's low income hurts one's mental health, and much dignity is lost without the independence of a personal income. For those just above the income threshold, this will mean financial and emotional hardship.

attributes.action: Make NHS gender service waiting times easier for transgender people
attributes.background: I am asking to ease the long waiting times for gender services in the UK, by allowing trans people to begin reversible treatment before they are seen by a specialist. This would prevent them from struggling with crippling gender dysphoria while they are on the waiting list, which can be over a year.
attributes.additional_details:
Lots of trans patients suffer with gender dysphoria, which in turn causes depression and suicidal feelings. Not being able to begin treatment can have a severe impact on mental health.
Many trans people take hormone blockers. This is a drug which is completely safe, 100% reversible and prevents trans people from going through changes which don't match their gender identity. All I ask is that the use of hormone blockers in the waiting period is considered, so their general wellbeing is improved.

attributes.action: legal aid for child acces cases so low income parents aren't stuck in a dispute.
attributes.background: Dad's up and down the country are left with no legal ways to gain access to their children after a dispute with an ex partner due to the high legal costs they can't afford. This has lead to suicide and unlawful attempts to see their children. For this reason. They need the help of the government.

attributes.action: Make compulsory all dogs in public spaces eg parks, footpaths etc to be on lead
attributes.background: The number of people, dogs and even farming livestock being attacked by dogs off lead is increasing. By making it compulsory for dogs to be on lead in public spaces at all times could reverse this trend. On the spot fines should be introduced.

attributes.action: Alter English National Curriculum to spread grammar evenly over the 4 Key Stages
attributes.background: Because standards of grammar dropped over recent years, educators are now expected to cover the majority of the curriculum for grammar over Key Sages 1 and 2 (ages 5-11).  This material should be spread over the 4 Key Stages.
attributes.additional_details: So much grammar is being shoe-horned into primary writing that the result is stressed educators, anxious children and unnatural writing.  Many parents themselves are unaware of what is expected of their children and are therefore unable to support them effectively.

attributes.action: Revise section 59 and withdraw the photographer / Car Spotter 48 hour ban/fine
attributes.background: Section 59 is being abused by officers, it is used to threaten high powered supercar owners. The Police Reform Act needs to be revised and officers reminded on how to use there authority. Also car spotters should not face any ban or fine due to the actions of drivers and should be left alone.
attributes.additional_details:
There have been 2 cases of police issuing bans to car spotters and i feel that it is assured, anyone has the right to take a picture. Even so there may be tourists who have flown in and may simply want to take a picture of a luxurious sports car to then face a ban in a well known tourist attraction with a fine. Also in the papers wealthy luxurious have been finding there stay here very troubling and unwelcoming as the police have been stopping them purely for the fact that they can.  

NOCKAM

attributes.action: Local councils must adhere to The Care Act; by offering choice of care provider.
attributes.background: In an attempt to reduce cost councils (LA's) are removing the right of choice from those who receive care and support. By appointing one provider forcing people to accept the care provider offered rather than the one better placed to support them.
attributes.additional_details:
Central to the Care Act 2014 is wellbeing. At the heart of the principle of wellbeing is ‘control over day- to-day life, including over care and support and the way it is provided.’

This is because choice and control is fundamental to the core purpose of adult care and support which the Care Act guidance sees as being to ‘help people to achieve the outcomes that matter to them in their life.’ 

Current practice is not recognising the legialation introduced to protect vulnerable people.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for patients to have a full blood count every 6-12 months
attributes.background: My 2 year old was poorly despite going to the doctors and seeing 3 different ones it was all dismissed as nothing and even though I asked for a blood test for her we were refused. I took her to A+E and the morning after she was diagnosed with luekemia on 06-04-16.
attributes.additional_details: My daughter at 2 years old was poorly for a few weeks with aches and pains, unexplained bruising, weight loss, constant fatigue and tiredness and a swollen face. GPS were of no help and we were dismissed each time. It took my health visitor to tell the gp there was something wrong for them to tell her to tell me to go to A+E the next day she was diagnosed with T-ALL and the swelling in her face was due to a tumour in her chest pressing on her airways she couldn't breathe properly + needed oxygen

attributes.action: Amend Shortage Occupation rules blocking hiring of Specialist Chefs from abroad
attributes.background: Britain's Asian restaurant industry is in crisis due to a shortage of Chefs. Though Specialist Chefs are on government's immigration Shortage Occupation List it disqualifies establishments that do Take Away,  Delivery, Buffet Dining and Event Catering as NOT having sufficient specialist skill needs
attributes.additional_details: THE INDUSTRY DEMANDS IMMEDIATE REDRESS AGAINST UNFAIR RULES blocking access to urgently needed Skilled Chefs. The vast majority of UK's estimated 10,000 Asian cuisine restaurants are experiencing staffing crisis with many successful businesses no longer able to operate. Many can meet official salary stipulation but are blocked by senseless ruling. The Asian restaurant sector is booming with increasing take away sales through online/smartphone ordering however government policy is stifling this
attributes.creator_name: Hans Raj Ram, CEO, Goldstar Chefs

attributes.action: Extend Harvey's Mandate to include all of England's council roads.
attributes.background: March 2nd 2015, Westminster enforced Harvey's Mandate. This ensured that any Dog or Cat killed on England's highways will be scanned for a micro chip, a detailed log report created, photographs taken and the animal kept in cold storage.  We now request that the Mandate covers all of England's roads.
attributes.additional_details: With the introduction of compulsory micro chipping it is unjust that authorities can then defend failing to scan any animal that has been killed on a Council road.  Each year 1,000's of pets are killed on England's Council roads and no effort is made to scan for a micro chip.  Owners are left searching for their pet not realising that it could, in fact, already have been sent to land fill or has been incinerated.  As recommended by John Hayes,  this Mandate should to cover all roads in England

attributes.action: cyclists to undertake theory and road tests and pay road tax and be insured
attributes.background: cyclists who wish to use the very busy road network have no training or experience thus adding to the dangers road users experience and pot holes and highway maintenence is partly funded by road tax so everyone should contribute who use the roads

attributes.action: Increase the national minimum wage for Apprentices
attributes.background: Apprenticeships are becoming an increasingly popular way for young people to begin their working life. I believe that it is completely unreasonable to pay 16-18 year olds only £3.30p/h. Please could this wage be reviewed or more help/financial support offered to familes of apprentices.
attributes.additional_details:
Apprentices working full time (40hrs p/w) are required to pay for various medical tests/items such as eyetests, prescriptions etc. 
As a young person, training to offer support and education to the children of Britain, why am I not supported by our government? I propose the government either highers the national minimum wage for apprentices, or offers financial help to our familes whome we still live with and therefore have to carry on supporting us (as if we are still in full time education).

attributes.action: Raise minimum wage of 18-20 year olds to that of 21 year olds
attributes.background: The current minimum wage for 18-20 year olds in the UK is £5.30. The current minimum wage for 21- 24 year olds is £6.70. This is a huge gap even though the cost of living is exactly the same; the cost of food, rent and bills is not lower - so why is the rate of pay?
attributes.additional_details: For every 40 hours a 21 year old works, an 18 year old has to work an additional 10 hours to earn the same amount of money - this is essentially an extra week's worth of work every month.18-20 year olds are constantly exploited in the workplace because of this. Working for 200 hours pays around £1,060 before tax and national insurance, working for the recommended 160 hours pays around £870. For a whole month this is not enough for an independent person to live off.

attributes.action: Don't cancel the British EU Referendum
attributes.background: In response to the petition "Cancel the planned referendum on Britain's continued membership of the EU" which is fundamentally an affront to the ability of the people to exercise their democratic will. Leave or Remain please show your support for a democratic process that enfranchises the people

attributes.action: Revise Sch. 3 of the Infrastructure bill to protect ownership of public land.
attributes.background: This schedule  is wrapped up in obfuscating languge that many MP's would not have understood. It is profoundly undemocratic in that local people  will have no say over the sale of public land. It overides existing laws designed to prevent this.The Government is overiding local people/democracy
attributes.additional_details: Every law designed to protect publicly owned land is to be overidden. The Government says this clause will only apply to surplus public land, but does not defines what surplus land is. The Government will have the final and only vote on any decision.

attributes.action: Make glucose tablets available on NHS prescription for Diabetics
attributes.background: When a Diabetic has a low blood sugar level they need to consume glucose to stop the progression to unconsciousness and possibly death. Glucose powder is on prescription, but has to be mixed with a drink before use, which may not be possible in emergencies. Tablets are ready to use at once.
attributes.additional_details:
I have written to MPs who, after enquiring, have come back to me saying that glucose tablets cannot be prescribed at present. The cost soon mounts up, which for families on a low income could mean missing out on certain things in order to provide this life saving 'medicine' ‒ especially if there is more than 1 Diabetic in the family.

This all reminds me of a situation we had years ago when drug addicts were given syringes and needles on prescription BEFORE Diabetics were allowed to have them!

attributes.action: Scrap handwriting requirement for highest writing grade at primary school
attributes.background: Talented, creative writers in primary school are being denied the opportunity to be acknowledged as such by their handwriting. Their flair and ability to engage and entertain a reader is considered of less worth than their ability to join up their handwriting. Sign now to stop this travesty.
attributes.additional_details: Pupils cannot be graded as writing above the expected standard at 11 yrs old unless they meet handwriting requirements of 'producing legible joined handwriting' and 'maintaining legibility, fluency and speed in handwriting through choosing whether or not to join specific letters.' The handwriting requirement is being placed above all mention of creativity and it's only the highest grade that has this handwriting veto. There are similar handwriting restrictions for talented writers at 7 as well.

attributes.action: Employers should have basic training on supporting transgender employees
attributes.background: I feel that it should be a legal requirement for one member of management or personell staff to have basic training on how to deal and support (if needed) a transgender employee in their workplace. There is a major lack of understanding and education about what it's like to be transgender.
attributes.additional_details:
More and more transgender people are finding the courage to come out to families and friends in the last year or so, meaning that there is now more transgender people in the workplace. 

Being transgender is something many people have no knowledge on at all.

For every 100 employees or so, there should be at least 1 member of management or personell staff that have basic training on transgender people.

attributes.action: Take Portugal's stances and decriminalize all drug possession.
attributes.background: The Portuguese government have decriminalised all illegal drugs. Drug addicts should not be treated like criminals and should be helped, not punished. Portugal has one of the lowest drug overdose rates in Europe whereas the UK has the highest.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drug_policy_of_Portugal

attributes.action: Raise old aged pensioners personal expenses allowance from £24.90 a week to £50
attributes.background: Once a person goes into a care home the Government takes away their private pension, their state pension and any other money they have and  allows them just  £24.90 a week. That has to pay for everything from clothes and toiletries, to small treats like having hair done or the odd day trip out.

attributes.action: Issue every Police Constable in England & Wales with a TASER by 01/01/17.
attributes.background: Police resources are continually stretch and the number of front line uniformed Police Constables is reduced year on year, whilst the number of violent crimes and assaults on Police continues to rise.  TASER is a proven less than lethal option and should be issued to front line uniformed officers.

attributes.action: Fund more beds in Northampton General to help reduce cancelled operations
attributes.background:
Northampton Hospital's Chief Executive Sonia Swart said 60 to 120 new beds are required to cope with daily pressures. She said: "Additional bed capacity would ensure patients operations weren't cancelled at the last minute." 
These beds are needed to ensure people get the right care.
attributes.additional_details: More beds at Northampton Hospital would 'save money' - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-northamptonshire-35937990

attributes.action: Stop the double taxation of fuel through Duty and VAT
attributes.background: Fuel is taxed using fuel duty and vat, which I consider to be an unfair double tax

attributes.action: Introduce a charge for single-use take-away coffee cups.
attributes.background:
Every year, 3 billion cups are thrown into landfill sites in the UK, taking up valuable space and resources.
Charging for each cup will raise awareness of the single-use cups impact on the environment and encourage consumers to carry their own re-usable cup (as we now carry our own bags).
attributes.additional_details:
Each paper cup contributes to 0.11kg of C02.
(Starbucks with Alliance for Environmental Innovation, April 2000)
Each cup requires 200 litres of water; the production of cups and lids contributes to the loss of millions of trees, the loss of habitat and to the degradation of the ecosystem.  
(WWF; www.appropedia.org/paper cup) 
The technology needed to produce 100% degradable or recyclable cups is not widely available. Precious resources are wasted now. A charge would reduce the consumption of single-use cups.

attributes.action: Force the BBC to scrap the licence fee in favour of funding from advertisements.
attributes.background: Since the 1940's the BBC have used scare tactics and in some cases, harassment to enforce the issuing of its TV licence fee on members of the general public. We would like for them to stop these tactics and obtain funding through advertisements like all other freeview channels.
attributes.additional_details:
http://goo.gl/Vi8jgg - BBC using bullying tactics.
http://goo.gl/Q8uqAS - BBC loses rights to host Olympic broadcasts.
http://goo.gl/wehWFk - BBC propaganda about licence fee.
http://goo.gl/LTvSIy - Sentencing inequality in courts.
http://goo.gl/vE5fJd - 60% of Brits prefer the ad supported model.

attributes.action: Stop the bombing of Syria, Iraq, Afghanistan and everywhere around the world.
attributes.background: Almost 2 million innocent men women and children have become victims of the so called war against terror since 2001. We the British Public are against the killing of anyone anywhere in the world. This War on Terror hasn't fulfilled its purpose but instead created more terrorist and enemies globally.
attributes.additional_details: Since 9/11 The US and her allies launched a full scale war against terrorists in Afghanistan killing 1000s of innocent men women and children. Then Iraq was attacked and 1000s more innocent lives were taken which lead to the creation of more terrorists. We The British public condemn these airstrikes and wars as the world has become a more dangerous place. We demand an immediate end to all bombings anywhere in the world and demand the British Government find an alternative solution.

attributes.action: Political neutrality rules should apply to both TV & newspapers during elections
attributes.background: Whilst recognising the need for a pluralistic press the referendum campaign demonstrated media barons attempt to influence voting. We believe this to be wrong and that newspapers should adopt a neutral, balanced and fair position during campaigns as TV news is required to do

attributes.action: Medals awarded to British service Personal to be made in UK not France.
attributes.background:
A French company has been awarded a contract to make 20 British honours including the Distinguished Service Order (DSO), awarded to senior Armed Forces officers for meritorious service during combat. 
Arthur Bertrandbeat beat bids from the likes of the Royal Mint. In a contract worth £1.3 million.

attributes.action: Abolish plans for extended Sunday trading hours in England
attributes.background: Sunday trading hours are already extensive enough without increasing them and further, removing any quality family time that may be enjoyed by those that work in the retail sector. Productivity and profit will not increase, only time and costs involved will be added to. Say no to extra time!
attributes.additional_details: 500 characters is not enough to lay the foundations of an objection to the extending of retail opening hours. I would however be happy to stand before parliament and offer my thoughts on any proposed increase to Sunday trading hours. Should any owner of a retail outlet in the UK, be opposed to my petition, then I will happily face them and debate my point until the proverbial cows come home! Please be aware, I would encourage substantial evidence to prove a benefit in increased trading hours.

attributes.action: Allocate time in the school timetable for volunteering
attributes.background:
School subjects are important. However, volunteering can teach children skills that they can't learn in the classroom. 

If kids start volunteering when they are young, they are much more likely to continue doing so as an adult.
attributes.additional_details:
We propose that time should be allocated on a weekly or fortnightly basis for pupils to volunteer for a cause in their local community. 

Whilst it is of benefit to the people that they are helping, volunteering can also be highly beneficial to those who participate in doing it. 

We are petitioning the government and Nicky Morgan MP, the education secretary to allocate time in the school timetable for children to experience the benefits of volunteering on a regular basis.

attributes.action: Stop plans for Transition Government in Zimbabwe that includes ZANU PF ministers
attributes.background: ZANU PF and life President Robert Mugabe via a system of patronage over the last 36 years has systematically destroyed the economy of Zimbabwe & impoverished its people. At the same time elite Ministers and cronies have become wealthy beyond measure, by effectively looting Zimbabwe's resources.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government in it's secretive Foreign Office has unilaterally decided that a TRANSITIONAL GOVERNMENT will be put in place to avoid "REGIONAL CHAOS" [sic], WHICH WILL INCLUDE the "elite" referred to in the previously. 
ZANU PF Ex-Ministers/Civil Servants/Sponsors cannot in any form be linked to Government or control of Finances. 
They will simply use this money to rig the 2018 elections as they have clearly done in 2008 and 2013 by using DEADLY VIOLENCE and systematic VOTER FRAUD
